ie it's not listing when selecting manual partitioning
no, surprisingly, sda and sdb are both listed in dmesg output, however, the installer only shows sdb

That usually happens when the installer thinks that the drive has fakeraid metadata that it doesn't understand. Rather than writing to it and possably destroying a RAID array it simply doesn't present it as an option (it should really warn the user that it's doing this but that's beside the point).
i will double check the bios, any way to confirm this from a shell?
Probably but I don't personally know how. The work around is to press F6 at the initial boot screen and select the "nodmraid" option.
Or zero out the beginning of sdb so that there isn't anything that would look like fakeraid metadata on it.
you are right, this is an old drive and was probably used in a raid config
I'm not sure I understand, you have a windows install on sda currently that you want to preserve?
I'd just use the nodmraid option then (if you're sure that the drive isn't actually part of a raid array).
